page.title: 03Home Life-Newton/Dunham area
page.content: Family Life in this rural area has not changed as much as urban areas. The family is still very much a unit with children remaining in the home until they marry or move to higher education. Unemployment has hit the area. Some families the mother is able to find work easier than the father. The average family has two or three children. Few boys work on the land. Television is the main entertainment in the home with radio a close second. This is followed by record playing equipment, young people being the biggest buyers of popular music records who often have record players in their bedrooms where they entertain their friends. Mother is the main cook and the tendency is to eat less meat but more natural foods.Coffee is more popular than tea.The main meal is eaten in the early evening.
